summary: INSTRUMENT PANEL CEASED TO FUNCTION WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS BEING DRIVEN.  PROBLEM APPARENTLY CAUSED BY DESIGN DEFECT IN CABLE ROUTING - WIRING TOO CLOSE TO ALTERNATOR, DAMAGED WIRING AND INSTRUMENT CLUSTER CIRCUITRY.  CABLES WERE REPLACED AT COST OF $235, BUT PROBLEM RETURNED 3 MONTHS LATER.  REPLACEMENT OF INSTRUMENT PANEL CIRCUIT BOARD NOW NECESSARY AT COST OF OVER $500.  WERE TOLD THAT CHRYSLER RECENTLY INCREASED COST OF PART TENFOLD.  DEALER REPORTED SEVERAL SIMILAR COMPLAINTS OVER PAST YEAR.  SAFETY ISSUE AS SPEEDOMETER AND SHIFT INDICATOR CEASED TO FUNCTION. *JB
